info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 26 at 5:30PM EDT until August 26 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Albemarle County in central Virginia... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 530 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Crozet, or 11 miles west of Charlottesville, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Crozet, Ivy, Esmont, Overton, Alberene, Damon, North Garden, Batesville, Covesville and Keene. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
